events.title: Welcome
events.story:
You are assigned to a new station, nearest to the front line. The previous General has died, killed, probably. The station in functional, but not intact. Maned with untrustworthy soldiers and officers. War makes men weary.
You get briefed shortly. Everybody has something urgent to do.

events.title: Closing Resource Supply
events.story: A virtual meeting is scheduled with Central Base. 'Due to the costs of the war, key resource supply has been exclusively dedicated to central and transport operations. Communication lines will...' You understand the meeting will lasts hours.
events.choice_text: You listen, You rise concerns, You leave

events.title: You listen silently
events.story: The meeting lasts longer than expected, though little else is said that interests you. Your superiors thank you for your patience and hard work.

events.title: You rise concerns
events.story: Your position is heard. You find support from fellow Generals, and discusions are had. In the end, the supply chain is still reduced, but you have made your position clear.

events.title: You leave
events.story: You have more important issues to attend right now. You leave someone of confidence to attend the meeting. They will report only the highlights.

events.title: X71
events.story: Your engineers have discovered old plans for a shooter tower. They say it will be more expensive, but will do more damage than the X21.

events.title: P36
events.story: Airstrike has been re-introduced to your sector. Local Operations is not optimist: things are expected to get uglier.

events.title: Lucky Find
events.story: Deep under a Control Tower, a vast supply of resources somehow has passed unnoticed. Did someone hide them down there? Engineers dismiss your concerns and celebrate the find.

events.title: Lucky Find
events.story: A scouting party discovers an abandoned line of convoys escorting transport ships. The destiny of the original drivers is unknown. Your orders are to bring the resources in.

events.title: Lucky Find
events.story: An engineers says he has found old plans for some production machine. It'll make a drastic change in the amount of resources produced. The experiment successfully yields an ample batch, but the machine wails to a hault. The engineers understand why this type of production was deprecated.

events.title: Dust Storm
events.story: Strong winds rise in the field. Tons of dust ride the storm. A shower of soft projectiles that make it impossible for humans to walk the surface. Most droids are unable to move.

events.title: Electric Storm
events.story: The air gets colder, sharper. The sky cuts down like a shadow. Every piece of metal becomes dangerous. Luckily, inside the Towers you are safe. You worry for your equipment on the field: some of it will become useless.

events.title: Empty Stocks
events.story: Your stocks remain empty. Unrest gets hold of your officers.
events.choice_text: Double effort, Request to Base, Beacon

events.title: Double production effort
events.story: Your officials are not pleased, but say they'll do the effort. Production quotas are measured slightly above average.

events.title: Request Base
events.story: Your request immediately gets pushed upward. You are esteemed between the leadership. An additional quota will be sent your way.

events.title: Mayday beacon
events.story: You turn the beacon on, to no avail.

events.title: Empty Stocks
events.story: Your stocks remain empty. Unrest gets hold of your officers.
events.choice_text: Double effort, Request to Base, Beacon

events.title: Double production effort
events.story: Your officials understand the situation, and communicate the urgency to their workers. Production quotas can be pushed higher only for short periods of time.

events.title: Request Base
events.story: After some hours of waiting, you are wired a strange protocolary document. You're to send it to BRS and await aproval.

events.title: Mayday beacon
events.story: You recieve a written answer that reads: "If you find any, mind sparing some ounce.

events.title: Empty Stocks
events.story: Your stocks remain empty. Unrest gets hold of your officers.
events.choice_text: Double effort, Request to Base, Beacon

events.title: Double production effort
events.story: The men are demotivated. Little attention is payed to your request, whilst production quotas remain even.

events.title: Request Base
events.story: You are reminded that an open war is being fought at all fronts. Nevertheless, they'll try to make it work for you.

events.title: Mayday beacon
events.story: A familiar voice comes through. They'll send what they can do without. It's not much, but it might suffice.

events.title: Asteroids
events.story: A soft tremble is felt troughout the Station. A silent shower of space debris falls on the Tactical Field. It will damage all pieces of equipment that fall under the rain.

events.title: Power station exploding
events.story: One of your new Power stations has gone unstable before collapsing open. Rarely does this happen. Some engineers will investigate the issue.

events.title: Offline
events.story: A power central has gone offline. Scavengers, or a power failure. No explosion is registered.

events.title: Go Check
events.story: You send a small convoy with some rangers and an engineer. Some pieces are missing. Scavengers. The engineer maneges to rescue some resources, but is unable to fix the station.

events.title: Offline
events.story: A power central has gone offline. Scavengers, or a power failure. No explosion is registered.

events.title: Go Check
events.story: You send a small convoy with some rangers and an engineer. The station has burned to the ground. The engineer wonders how it managed to stay stable through the fire. The power core is missing.

events.title: Offline
events.story: A power central has gone offline. Scavengers, or a power failure. No explosion is registered.

events.title: Go Check
events.story: You send a small convoy with some rangers and an engineer. They return, puzzled. There is no station, and the land shows no sign of ever being one.

events.title: Offline
events.story: A tower has gone offline! Scavengers, or a power failure. No explosion is registered.

events.title: Go Check
events.story: You send a small convoy with some rangers and an engineer. They aren't able to reach the station before they're attacked. No one survived.

events.title: Dismiss
events.story: It's more expensive to send an engineer team than to construct a new one. You forget about the station.

events.title: Wierd dreams
events.story: You wake up confused, light-headed. You know something lurks deep under. Breathing slowly, rythmically, it takes you over a minute to spin back to your room. Being too close to the reactors messes up with people.

events.title: A man
events.story: A man is seen running the Tactical Field towards your gate.

events.title: Open the Gate
events.story: You order Transport Ops to open the gate. The man is gravely burned. Chems. He shivers, whilst you try to interrogate him. He's sent to infermery but dies a within the hour.

events.title: Shoot him down
events.story: He's deemed dangerous, and must be eliminated. Security shoot from their posts and take him down effortlessly

events.title: Ignore the man
events.story: He's not uniformed, probably a scavenger or a spy. He does not make it past the electrified mines.

events.title: Crypted signal
events.story: An emergency beacon is detected. A clear emergency signal, completely crypted.

events.title: Track Coordenates
events.story: Your operary tracks the signal to the original source. You try to connect, but realize the station is actually decomissioned. You inform Local Ops, they say they'll handle it from here.

events.title: Inform Intelligence
events.story: You head to Intelligence Offices in the second pavilion with the crypted message. Dark, segregated office with darker people. They're not happy to see you. A few phonecalls are made, a hellicopter arrives. Before you get dismissed, they make you sign a security clearence. "For your political protection" they say, though you're unable to read it fully.

events.title: Crypted signal
events.story: An emergency beacon is detected. A clear emergency signal, completely crypted.

events.title: Track Coordenates
events.story: You track the coordenates to Local Operations. You connect with them directly. They seem surprised, and unhappy. The beacon dies shortly thereafter.

events.title: Inform Intelligence
events.story: You forward the incoming signal to Intelligence. They ask you to ignore the beacon. 20 minutes later a helicopter arrives, and leaves hastily. The next day you get a private telegram from Central asking you for a formal report on the incident.

events.title: Ignore the signal
events.story: Your tower does not dispose of the necessary decryption tools. You leave the beacon die.

events.title: High above
events.story: In your way up to Communications Bay, the elevator gets jammed. You are left alone before the expance of the desert. Your mind drifts away into the deep distance. It takes the tecnics an hour to get you out.

events.title: Tactical field
events.story: A small mission requires that you venture into the Tactical Field afoot. You're escorted by some rangers and a security officer. The expanse of the desert draws you, silently. Back in the Field Ops office you linger a minute in front of the windows, facing the desert.

events.title: The last sunset
events.story: From Field Operations Bay, a powerful sunset can be seen today. The desert ahead is almost peaceful.

events.title: No sleep
events.story: You cannot manage to sleep again. A wierd sense that someone, somewhere is scheming to kill you.

events.title: Unknown room
events.story: A dusty folder is presented at your desk. The cadet says he found it amongst old reports. It presents non-standard plans for the Control Towers; rooms and hallways populate it in weird ways.

events.title: Send someone
events.story: They find the body of a young man, deep within the underground storage facilities. It's cadet you sent to investigate the unknown room. They send his body back to Cental.

events.title: Unknown room
events.story: A dusty folder is presented at your desk. The cadet says he found it amongst old reports. It presents non-standard plans for the Control Towers; rooms and hallways populate it in weird ways.

events.title: Send someone
events.story: You give the plans to some engineers to value its worth. They come back announcing a forgotten deposit warehouse in the lower levels. The resources get added to your main deposit.

events.title: Go yourself
events.story: You take a tour around the facilities, but discover nothing of importance. Tired, you head back. There's work to be done.

events.title: Dismiss
events.story: You have more urgent things to do. Besides, it’s a deprecated report, probably worth nothing.

events.title: Strange Marks
events.story: Some strange marks appear outside the main warehouse gate. Signs of some sort, maybe a language. No forced entry yet.

events.title: Minimize routines
events.story: Some things are not meant to be known. Daily routines are kept to their essentials only.

events.title: Step up the patrol routines
events.story: Soldiers are superstitious, they don’t appreciate being outside during days like these. Nothing is reported yet.

events.title: Ignore the signs
events.story: You ignore the stories. Superstitions are of no use during open war. Besides, it's probably a prank of some kind.

events.title: Death by night
events.story: The night guard, a security cadet, is found dead at his post in the morning. No wound nor marks, his body rests awkwardly with his eyes open. You have the body sent back to Central.

events.title: Animal company
events.story: From the Field Ops Bay you spot something moving in the distance. A tall, elegant lion-like figure walks the width of the wall. He looks up, then breaks to a run far from sight. They're rare, but do, from time to time, show up.

events.title: Animal company
events.story: A flock of small flying beasts finds you mid-way between stations. They are silent, but very predatory, and they gather up tight enought to darken the sky.

events.title: Animal company
events.story: You get informed by Local Ops that a very big pack of wolve-like animals haunts the area. Protocollary scouting teams make rounds to find the beasts.

events.title: Dispose soldiers
events.story: You assign turns to a fresh team of scouts to patrol the perimeters.

events.title: Dispose rangers
events.story: You inform the rangers and they organize themselves to scouting parties.

events.title: Dismiss the warning
events.story: You ignore the warning. It'll be your problem if they show up in your perimeter.

events.title: Animal company
events.story: The scouting party got ambushed by the creatures. Only a few animal bodies, scraps of cloth and some weapons are left.

events.title: Animal company
events.story: The scouting party found the creatures and gave them a swift end. They all take a tooth that they'll hang round their chests, as a sign of respect and dominance.

events.title: Animal attack
events.story: One of your security scouting parties got ambushed by some creatures. Only a few animal bodies, scraps of cloth and some weapons are left.

events.title: Asteroids
events.story: A shower of small space debris falls on the Tactical Field.

events.title: Missed meeting
events.story: You recieve a communication: "Your abscence has been noted." Someone was expecting you.

events.title: Report
events.story: A report arrives from Local Ops. It tells the state of your sector in the war. "Too expensive" and "inefficient" are words widely repeated.

events.title: Useless
events.story: Word reaches your office about a coup in a nearby station. You could have done nothing to aid, you say aloud.

events.title: Private virtual conference
events.story: You are called to the Comunications Bay. There's a few Generals of your rank having a private conference. You're invited to share tactics and advice. It's a fruitful meeting.

events.title: Pleasant visit
events.story: Some small convoys park outside the station. A General of your rank wants to personally meet you. You recognize him from some virtual meetings. He's getting relieved, and says he admires your courage and wouldn't leave without saluting you.

events.title: Invitation
events.story: A veteran officer mentions an anecdote wherein he served with a fellow officer of a name you're familiar with: a now General commander of a neighbouring station. You convene a meeting with them both and a few other Generals. The evening is a pleasant one, old memories relived and new friends made.

events.title: Blue Flash
events.story: A strong blue light obfuscates your view. You hear a loud high pitch. Your thoughts thin out. You lay confused, stunned on your spot. Far away on this very planet, a Power reactor has gone offline.

events.title: Offer help
events.story: Protocol requires you to offer support. You head to the Communication Bay and put your men to the task.

events.title: No time to offer help
events.story: There's no time to head to the Communication Bay to offer support. We have our own problems now.

events.title: No one's there
events.story: No beacon is detectable. You leave your message inline open. Someone might answer later.

events.title: An answer
events.story: Heavy fire... Lines breached... Send men.

events.title: Send men
events.story: 2 teams of soldiers are gathered in their convoys. They leave hastily.

events.title: Ignore the message
events.story: The coordinates mark a station too far out. Besides, you don't have the man power for such a mission. You ignore the message.

events.title: Men return
events.story: Your men return from the mission victorious. They boast their deeds and inspire fellow soldiers.

events.title: Mayday Call
events.story: A protocolary mayday call arrives from a nearby Control Outpost

events.title: Send resources
events.story: You can spare some resources. You trust they will be put to good use.

events.title: Send soldiers
events.story: A transmition comes thru the Com Bay: “we were barely pulling thru. We couldn’t have made it without your help.” They send some few resources they can now spare in form of gratitude.

events.title: Ignore message
events.story: Your situation is dear enough, and cannot afford to spare attention.

events.title: Mayday Call
events.story: A protocolary mayday call arrives from a nearby Control Outpost

events.title: Send soldiers
events.story: Your soldiers are barely able to make it to the Outpost. Communication is ended shortly after. No further information is recoverable.

events.title: Ignore message
events.story: Your situation is dear enough, and cannot afford to spare attention.

events.title: Emergency Beacon
events.story: Your Communications Bay picks up a friendly emergency beacon. It might come from another Control Tower.

events.title: Attend the beacon
events.story: You send a protocolary answer. You await an answer. The beacon dies off after some hours.

events.title: Emergency Beacon
events.story: Communication Bay picks up a friendly emergency beacon. It might come from another Control Tower.

events.title: Attend the beacon
events.story: You open your answer channel and pick up a H2002 thru local line 1, code for "Breach". You rally 5 convoys of soldiers and rangers, and send them that way.

events.title: Attend the beacon
events.story: Half your men return, most of them wounded. They have no story of victory to boast.

events.title: Emergency Beacon
events.story: Your Communication Bat pick up a friendly emergency beacon. It might come from another Control Tower.

events.title: Attend the beacon
events.story: You turn on your answer line and pick up a protocollary A1101 thru local line 1, code for "Insurgency". You connect directly with Local Operations and inform them of the issue. They're thank your help, and will manage the situation from here.

events.title: Ignore the beacon
events.story: You cannot afford to spend any resources tracing the beacon. Anyway, it dies off after some hours.

events.title: Hospitality
events.story: A truck calls for atention at the gates of the Tactical Field. You welcome them in. Enemy-line rangers scouting the desert ask for your hospitality.

events.title: Welcome them
events.story: There's extra room for soldiers at your base.

events.title: New Rangers
events.story: The enemy-line rangers seem to like it here. You tell them that you're short in men. They happily join your ranks.

events.title: Dismiss
events.story: You appologize, but there's no way you can help them. They camp outside the gates and leave the next day.

events.title: Safe heaven
events.story: A two-truck convoy waits at the gates of the Tactical Field. You welcome them in. Enemy-line rangers fresh from battle ask for your hospitality.

events.title: Welcome them
events.story: They thank you. Sleep the night at the barracks, share food with your men and share stories. They leave early the next day.

events.title: Rouge ranger
events.story: One of your rangers has gone rouge and attacked a nearby station. He was succesfully put down, not without a fight. Three men are dead now, and they blame your command ineficiency.

events.title: Rouge rangers
events.story: A few rangers have broken protocol in Local Ops ceremony. You are not told what they have done, only that "they're not a problem any more." You're held responsible for their actions.

events.title: Security threat
events.story: A security meeting is had. Your station is underperforming, acording to standards. You are a security threat to your sector.

events.title: Reassignment
events.story: You are assigned reinforcement to the cost of men from nearby stations. This makes your political position within the sector unfavorable, but you'll have more men to defend the enemy.

events.title: Upgrades
events.story: The Communications Bay in your station does not mirror the mandatory protocols for network commnication." You are a black whole within the network. You upgrade your Communications Bay.

events.title: Fauna re-flourish
events.story: The lack of mandatory hunting activity within your men is making the natural fauna reflourish to a hazardous level. You are to upscale your hunting efforts.

events.title: Escorted visitor
events.story: A humvee is escorting a prisoneer to Central, but have little fuel left. You're required to aid them. They replenish and leave hastily.

events.title: Last contact
events.story: Communication is increasingly dangerous. Central base restricts your output line to "Emergency Only".

events.title: Report
events.story: A report arrives to your office from Central Base. You know that Central is not happy with your performance. You skim thru the thing and continue your tasks.

events.title: Reassignment
events.story: Some of your best men get reassigned to other stations. Central base mistrust your leadership.

events.title: High clearance visitor
events.story: A high ranking diplomat is visiting. You tend to his needs. He schedules a few meetings with the officers, inspects the place and takes due notes. He leaves hastily in a different direction.

events.title: Valuale information
events.story: Your scouting party discovers an enemy ship crashed near your station. Their communications system is intact. You let Intelligence into the issue. They thank you and proceed with the investigation.

events.title: Valuale information
events.story: A group or rangers come back with a series of strange artifacts. You recognize the enemy design. You inform Intelligence, who sends a cadet to fetch the artifact. A few days later you're thanked for your good work.

events.title: Power shifts
events.story: News from Central is that the leadership was too corrupt, and was "cleaned up". Your department of Internal affairs is nowhere to be seen.

events.title: Power shifts
events.story: The old dies to give way to the new. Big players were replaced, you hear, for new faces. They are young and full of energy. They recognize your efforts.

events.title: Power shifts
events.story: The leadership sees fit to replace some big players. Your link with Central will now be managed by Reserve Operations. They dislike you and your kind. To them you're no more than a vain soldier.

events.title: Coup d'état
events.story: A coup takes control of operations at central. They let you know that there will be changes in the way things are run. Your whole department of Security and Internal Affairs gets replaced.

events.title: Safe passing
events.story: Three trucks are parked outside the main access road to the station. They request access to the Tactical Field, thru your station. Due to their clearence level, you cannot deny the request. They cross the whole station, and cross the Tactical Field gate towards the enemy line.

events.title: Safe passing
events.story: A huge caravan of military trucks park outside the main access road. They request access to the Tactical Field, thru your station. Due to their clearence level, you cannot deny the request. They cross the station, and enter the Tactical Field, towards the enemy line.

events.title: Slient mission
events.story: Intelligence informs you of a special mission for a small group of men. The nature of the mission is to remain secret. They round up a few rangers and leave hastily, towards the Tactical Field.

events.title: Ghost mission
events.story: A meeting is schedules at Intelligence. Three suited men you never seen before wait for you.

events.title: Sit silently
events.story: They interrogate your line of work and your political trajectory. They're happy that you never served office. "You are in a very interesting position, geographically and politically. Would you be prepared to help this administration in deeper ways?

events.title: Ghost mission
events.story: We'll disclose with you only what pertains your team." You are to sacrifice a team of seasoned rangers to a special mission on the other side of the Tactical Field. They'll recieve special briefings and training, and leave within a week.

events.title: You leave
events.story: We prefer it be kept under your explicit desicion. You won't be bothered any further.

events.title: Crack a joke
events.story: Nobody laughs. You were never good at jokes anyway. The men ask some protocollary questions and dismiss you.

events.title: Ghost mission
events.story: They're to be isolated from the rest of the men into the Intelligence pavilion, for security reasons. The nature of the mission is to remain classified. Failure to do so, due to negligence or bad faith, will be met with dire consequences." You're handed a grief to sign.

events.title: Sign the brief
events.story: I might add, we're very happy with the developement of this station, General." Other formalities are said, and you're dismissed.

events.title: Refuse to sign
events.story: Well, that is very unfortunate." You're handed another contract to sign, which acknowledges your negative answer. You're dismissed.

events.title: Dead politician
events.story: A black car comes speeding into your station, and gets shot down by security. Some soldiers manage to identify a famous politician in the back seat, now dead. You inform of the incident to Central Operations. They seem confuse, but you send them the evidence.

events.title: Rouge soldier
events.story: A rouge soldier is heading your way, thru the main access road. You send a Humvee to intersect them. They're put down, not without a fight.

events.title: Inefficiency
events.story: Due to your inefficiency in the field, your place as a General is being questioned by your superiors." The message is on a no-reply line. No place for dispute is allowed.

events.title: Treason
events.story: Reading a report you realize that an Intelligence officer might be commiting some sort of treason or evation. You report it to Central. They'll investigate the issue.

events.title: Political uncertainty
events.story: The political panorama at Central seems more chaotic than usual. Your Intelligence officials are nowhere to be seen. You raise concerns to Local Ops, but they deny your line.

events.title: Enemy of the state
events.story: You're holding an enemy of the state. Please hand them in to us inmediatelly." A short message directly from Central Ops, followed by the name of an Intelligence Officer. Some soldiers are sent to capture the officer and escort him back to Central.

events.title: Enemy of the state
events.story: You're holding an enemy of the state. Please hand them in to us inmediatelly." A short message directly from Central Ops, followed by the name of an Intelligence Officer. You send men to search him but he's nowhere to be found.

events.title: Desertion
events.story: Some soldiers are weary and decide to abandon their post. They are now deserters, and can be executed if found. They managed to steal some valuable resources.

events.title: Inner tensions rise
events.story: You notice an increase in antisocial behaviour. Soldiers gang up against anyone who makes a mistake. Discussions typically get heated. You're recommended to pay attention to your surroundings at all times.

events.title: An incident
events.story: You overhear a discussion, somewhat above tolerance level. Some loud bump and a gun fire. No one is hurt.

events.title: National festivity
events.story: Today is a national festivity back home. Everyone lingers longer at the diner at night. Stories are told and memories shared.

events.title: Games
events.story: Some soldiers are organising a card game competition. They sort themselves into teams. Matches last 20 minutes, and 3 matches are had per night. The tournament will last for another week.

events.title: Video Games
events.story: Some engineers manage to fix an old console from the storage. It will provide ample recreation for the weary soldiers.

events.title: Deserters at sight
events.story: A group of soldiers are spotted camping a few kilometers from the Towers. They don’t seem to have much order, or routine. Probably deserters.

events.title: Execute them
events.story: Protocol says you should execute deserters. You send a convoy of your men. Your men come back safely.

events.title: Bring them in
events.story: You send a convoy to bring them in. They say their camp has given in to the enemy, and bring some resources that might come useful. You quickly find a task for them. Fresh faces will surely boost the crew’s morale.

events.title: Leave them be
events.story: They are not under your command and won’t interfere with your operations. You have more important things to attend to.

events.title: Insurgency
events.story: The rangers don’t like your way of things, and think to propose otherwise.

events.title: Attempt dialogue
events.story: No dialogue could be met, but they are no longer a problem. They managed to sabotage a batch of resources that are now useless. The new rangers dislike you, naturally.

events.title: Execute insurgents
events.story: You cannot afford to have insurgents go unpunished. They are taken outside and executed. The new rangers dislike you, naturally.

events.title: Jail them
events.story: Protocol requires that you jail them. You keep them away from any further contact and wait for central base to send a pick-up. The new rangers think little of you.

events.title: Desertion
events.story: You get informed that another group of soldiers has not presented themselves to duty this morning. They're nowhere no be found.

events.title: Desertion
events.story: An officer stumbles weary into your office. "3 more this morning, General.

events.title: Show
events.story: Local Ops has had the great iniciative to finance comedians to perform at Stations within your sector. The men will be delighted

events.title: Relief
events.story: Reinforcements get assigned to your station. The most weary men get to go home.

events.title: Reinforcements
events.story: Reinforcements get assigned to your station. Fresh men arrive to ocuppy empty spots within the troops.

events.title: Training
events.story: A group of cadets get assigned to your station. You're to see that they understand the workings of war. They might even boost the morale of your men.

events.title: Ranger training
events.story: A group of seasoned rangers get assigned to your station. They're to oversee your rangers' operations. There's much that experience can do.

events.title: Fresh hunt
events.story: A group of scouts return carrying a few dead animals. The men gather around an improvised fire and roast the black meat.

events.title: Fresh hunt
events.story: A large pack of buffalo-like beasts show up in the Tactical Field. Security outposts shoot a few of them don. The rangers rescue the fresh meat. The dinner is abundant and fresh.

events.title: Disease
events.story: Local Ops warns you of a heavy outbreak in nearby stations.

events.title: Take security measures
events.story: You take the necesarry security precautions. Food is to be washed and cook extensively. Cleaning procedures are enhanced and symptomatic men are quarantined inmediatelly.

events.title: Ignore the warning
events.story: The contact you maintain with other stations is minimal. Your duty is with the enemy.

events.title: Disease
events.story: A highly contagious virus has appeared in your station. Five soldiers, including an Officer, are ill and kept in quarantine.

events.title: Quarantine the men
events.story: The men are treated and isolated. Two of them die, but the rest recovers shortly after. A close call.

events.title: Execute the men
events.story: The virus is a security threat, and protocol explicitly says you should take care of security threats inmediately. The men are swiftly terminated and their bodies cremated. Dark clouds looms over the station.

events.title: Dismiss
events.story: Health department will take care of the situation.

events.title: Disease
events.story: A heavy virus has swept the station. More than half of your men are ill.

events.title: Disease
events.story: A deadly parasite has got hold of a pavillion B2. The men are kept in quarantine.

events.title: Execute the men
events.story: The parasite is a security threat. The compromised subjects get terminated humainly, their bodies cremated. A dark day looms over the station.

events.title: Have Intelligence handle the issue
events.story: A long caravan of transport trucks arrives with haste. They set a perimeter around the compromised pavilion, and extract the men by threes in small metal carts. The carts are piled up inside the trucks. The station will be under strict surveilance for ten more days to prevent further outbreaks.

events.title: Disease
events.story: Most quarantined men die during the first days. The other 25% survive. The parasite takes a permanent toll on their health. The better decision is to relieve them.

events.title: Insurgents
events.story: Outside of your room, a group of your soldiers await you. They demand your inmediate surrender.

events.title: Damn them
events.story: You curse them. They're armed and angry. They have no mercy on your body. You get replaced the next day.

events.title: Surrender
events.story: They cuff you and take you to the underground warehouses. You're tied to a shelf and asked for any last words. The execution is swift.

events.title: Soldiers at your door
events.story: An army of soldiers gather on the main access road. They are friendly, from a nearby station, but won't seem to communicate.

events.title: Go to meet them
events.story: You go out to their encounter. They say to have express orders to take control of this tower. They seem to have no haste.

events.title: Invite them in
events.story: You urge them to accompany you to the communication bay. As you turn around you hear a shot, and loose grasp of your feet. You fall clumsily and confused.

events.title: Deny them
events.story: You ask for their names and credentials. The General looks at you square in one eye, while a few of his men come around him and shoot you square in the other.

events.title: Ignore them
events.story: You continue with your daily tasks. You hear a discussion outside your office, and a shot.. Before you can reach your gun, a few men break into your office and execute you on the spot.

events.title: Desert
events.story: The war is going nowhere. A plan has been scketching out for a month: a sector desertion. You make due preparations and sign up all your loyal men. Come the morning, the station is empty.

events.title: Suicide mision
events.story: The hold is of no utility. Advance ASAP", the message continues with some tactical details. You're to charge the enemy lines at dusk.

events.title: Organize the plan
events.story: You rally your men, ignoring the massive desertion since the message. Your convoy gets loaded as you take your place. The garage gates open. Ahead of you, the expanse of the desert.

events.title: You get called back to central
events.story: Your prowess has earned you a meeting with some high ranking officials. You're to head back to Central, just when the flighting is getting heaviest. A helicopter arrives with your replacement, a green boy no older than 25. You board the ship, not looking back.

events.title: Killed
events.story: All the towers have been destroyed. The enemy advance to the next station. Your body lies under the rubble.
